channel.title: Rebecca Li
channel.description: {"meta"=>"Rebecca Li is an undergraduate in Mechanical Engineering and Robotics at MIT.", "subtitle"=>"Rebecca's personal thought dump, project bank, and art haus."}

item.title: Frozen Chainsaw Massacre
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"Rebecca Li", "email"=>"rebecca@mit.edu", "info"=>nil}
item.description:
The summer comes with wonderful joys. Ice cream, air conditioning, free time, and go-karts. Last summer I played pit crew for Charles Guan’s Chibi Mikuvan.
Chibi Mikuvan: the most Adorable little van, on top of it’s muse. Source: www.etotheipiplusone.net

item.title: Nine Phase Motor Controller
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"Rebecca Li", "email"=>"rebecca@mit.edu", "info"=>nil}
item.description: Over the summer, I had the privilege of participating in the PowerWheels Racing Series. Think back to the little toy cars 5 year olds rode in made of plastic and hot rod dreams.

item.title: New Website
item.dc:creator: {"name"=>"Rebecca Li", "email"=>"rebecca@mit.edu", "info"=>nil}
item.description: Blogs are like keeping a small animal. Occasionally you have to feed them. Occasionally you have to maintain their appearance, and occasionally they’re a pain in the ass to do so. My previous website was built on Anchor CMS, an unwieldy heavy website for beautiful blogging. A SQL server later, I had Anchor running with a metric ton of backend and little bits of PHP.
